column4: I'm wondering what the best way to upgrade from 11.10 to 12.04 -- gosh darn I hate upgrading
: reninstall is recommended - from scratch
That way you can't have any issues...I've built scripts to
reconfigure once I do a reinstall
I hate clean upgrades -- I got a separate home partition -- but all the customization within /etc and the udev scripts --- SUCKS
Cinnamon here for me...
10.10 << Good release. 11.04 << Bad release. 12.04 << Should be good release :)
where is 11.10 in that schema?
I left it out because I didn't do much testing for 11.10...
So I'm not gonna comment...
I wanted to use unity, but I couldn't see my desktop because the unity bar was taking up the entire screen
I'm going to try to go to my first "installfest" to try to help newbies and talk and such this weekend...
good for you, exciting
My loco team is meeting 10 miles from my house :) ...So I'ma check it out
the loco team near me is dead
: Start a new one :)
How?  How to get the word out?
loco.ubuntu.com
Mailing lists and such
I'll have to check that out!  The irc channel for the loco was dead
I see...The IRC loco is dead...but they said that it usually is with the sign up email
Certain times of the day for sceduling, depending on the loco team
report back how it goes
